user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_bus_register:
```c
int metal_bus_register(struct metal_bus *bus)
{
	if (!bus || !bus->name || !strlen(bus->name))
		return -EINVAL;
	if (metal_bus_find(bus->name, NULL) == 0)
		return -EEXIST;
	metal_list_init(&bus->devices);
	metal_list_add_tail(&_metal.common.bus_list, &bus->node);
	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "registered %s bus\n", bus->name);
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_bus_register:
struct metal_bus {
	const char		*name;
	struct metal_bus_ops	ops;
	struct metal_list	devices;
	struct metal_list	node;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
metal_list_init(&bus->devices);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the call metal_list_init(&bus->devices) is reachable. The function returns early only when bus is NULL or bus->name is empty or when a bus with the same name already exists; otherwise execution continues to the metal_list_init call. Given the prior checks, dereferencing bus to take &bus->devices is valid and the statement can be executed at runtime, so there is no unreachable code in this fragment.
